member.name: M:MadWizard.WinUSBNet.USBDevice.ControlTransfer(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Initiates a control transfer over the default control endpoint. This method allows both IN and OUT direction transfers, depending on the highest bit of the parameter. Alternatively, and can be used for control transfers in a specific direction, which is the recommended way because it prevents using the wrong direction accidentally. Use the ControlTransfer method when the direction is not known at compile time.
member.param: The setup packet request type.
The setup packet device request.
The value member in the setup packet. Its meaning depends on the request. Value should be between zero and 65535 (0xFFFF).
The index member in the setup packet. Its meaning depends on the request. Index should be between zero and 65535 (0xFFFF).

The data to transfer in the data stage of the control. When the transfer is in the IN direction the data received will be written to this buffer. For an OUT direction transfer the contents of the buffer are written sent through the pipe.
Length of the data to transfer. Must be equal to or less than the length of . The setup packet's length member will be set to this length.

member.name: M:MadWizard.WinUSBNet.USBDevice.EndControlTransfer(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Waits for a pending asynchronous control transfer to complete.
member.param: The object representing the asynchonous operation, as returned by one of the ControlIn, ControlOut or ControlTransfer methods.
member.returns: The number of bytes transfered during the operation.
member.remarks: Every asynchronous control transfer must have a matching call to to dispose of any resources used and to retrieve the result of the operation. member.name: P:MadWizard.WinUSBNet.USBPipePolicy.AllowPartialReads

member.name: P:MadWizard.WinUSBNet.USBPipePolicy.AutoClearStall
member.summary: When true, the driver fails stalled data transfers, but the driver clears the stall condition automatically. Default value is false.
member.seealso: WinUSB_GetPipePolicy for a more detailed description

member.name: P:MadWizard.WinUSBNet.USBPipePolicy.AutoFlush
member.summary: If both AllowPartialReads and AutoFlush are true, when the device returns more data than requested by the client it will discard the remaining data. Default value is false. Only available on IN direction pipes.
member.seealso: WinUSB_GetPipePolicy for a more detailed description

member.name: P:MadWizard.WinUSBNet.USBPipePolicy.IgnoreShortPackets
member.summary: When true, read operations are completed only when the number of bytes requested by the client has been received. Default value is false. Only available on IN direction pipes.
member.seealso: WinUSB_GetPipePolicy for a more detailed description

member.name: P:MadWizard.WinUSBNet.USBPipePolicy.PipeTransferTimeout
member.summary: Specifies the timeout in milliseconds for pipe operations. If an operation does not finish within the specified time it will fail. When set to zero, no timeout is used. Default value is zero.
member.seealso: WinUSB_GetPipePolicy for a more detailed description

member.name: P:MadWizard.WinUSBNet.USBPipePolicy.RawIO
member.summary: When true, read and write operations to the pipe must have a buffer length that is a multiple of the maximum endpoint packet size, and the length must be less than the maximum transfer size. With these conditions met, data is sent directly to the USB driver stack, bypassing the queuing and error handling of WinUSB. Default value is false.
member.seealso: WinUSB_GetPipePolicy for a more detailed description

member.name: P:MadWizard.WinUSBNet.USBPipePolicy.ShortPacketTerminate
member.summary: When true, every write request that is a multiple of the maximum packet size for the endpoint is terminated with a zero-length packet. Default value is false. Only available on OUT direction pipes.
member.seealso: WinUSB_GetPipePolicy for a more detailed description
